metadata.case_name: Andhra Pradesh State Road Transport Corporation v. Income-tax Officer and Appellate Assistant Commissioner of Income-tax

facts.text: Appellant established under Road Transport Corporations Act, 1950 (No. 64 of 1950) by notification issued by Andhra Pradesh Government, functioning with effect from 11th January, 1958.
Before formation of appellant Corporation, road transport was a department of Government of Hyderabad and after integration, run by Government of Andhra Pradesh, treated as exempt from income-tax.
Income-tax Department served notice under s.22 of Income-tax Act on appellant on 29th January, 1959.

Impugned assessment orders passed by respondent No.1 (Income-tax Officer) on 29th February, 1960: for 1958-59 (period 11-1-1958 to 31-3-1958) tax of Rs. 13,60,963.86 nP.; for 1959-60 (period 1-4-1958 to 31-3-1959) tax of Rs. 34,44,430.48 nP.
Appellant filed Writ Petition Nos. 516 to 519 of 1960 in Andhra Pradesh High Court against respondents, claiming writ of prohibition and quashing of assessment orders.
High Court dismissed writ petitions on 14th July, 1961 with costs.
Appellant obtained certificate from High Court and filed appeals in Supreme Court.

Before Income-tax Officer, appellant argued it does not fall under five categories of assessees under s.3 of Income-tax Act; net income goes to State under s.30 of Act, immune under Art.289; local authority exempt.

High Court held appellant not State-owned Corporation, not carrying business on behalf of Government, trade not incidental to ordinary functions of government, no declaration under Art.289(3); not local authority; no repugnancy.

legal_issues.text: Whether income of appellant from transport activities is exempt from Union taxation under Art.289(1) of Constitution.
Whether appellant falls within categories of assessees under s.3 of Income-tax Act.
Whether appellant is local authority exempt from income-tax.
Whether charging section of Income-tax Act repugnant to ss.28,29,30 of Road Transport Corporations Act.

petitioner_arguments.text: Appellant independent body carrying road transport business, does not fall under five categories of assessees under s.3 of Income-tax Act (individual, HUF, firm, company, association of persons).

Net income ultimately goes to State of Andhra Pradesh under s.30 of Act, immune from Union taxation under Art.289(1). Trading activities carried on 'by or on behalf of' State under Art.289(2), hence included in Art.289(1). Corporation State-controlled and owned.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Art.289 Constitution; s.30 Road Transport Corporations Act; Akadasi Padhan v. State of Orissa

petitioner_arguments.text: Appellant is local authority exempt from income-tax.
Notice under s.22 invalid; charging section of Income-tax Act repugnant to ss.28,29,30 of Act; Act (1950) prevails over Income-tax Act (1922).
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: ss.28,29,30 Road Transport Corporations Act; s.43 State Financial Corporations Act, 1951; s.43 Damodar Valley Corporation Act, 1948

respondent_arguments.text: Appellant liable to tax as income from trade/business; not exempt under Art.289 as not income of State; not local authority; no repugnancy.

court_reasoning.text: Transport activity not incidental to ordinary functions of government; concedes but argues included in Art.289(1) via Art.289(2) as carried on 'by or on behalf of' State.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Cl.(2) exception to cl.(1); trading activities deemed included in cl.(1) but taxable unless declared under cl.(3).

court_reasoning.text: Corporation has separate legal personality distinct from State; income not State's income under Art.289(1) despite State control/ownership; Act provisions emphasize separate entity (ss.3,4,5,23,28,29,30,38,39).
court_reasoning.key_observation: No statutory provision lifts corporate veil to make income State's; s.30 entrusts surplus for specific purpose, not general revenue.

court_reasoning.text: Rejects American doctrine of instrumentalities immunity; rejected in State of West Bengal v. Union of India.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Decide on construction of Art.289, not foreign doctrine.

court_reasoning.text: Not local authority; no repugnancy as ss.28-30 deal with fund administration, not tax exemption; Income-tax Act annually updated via Finance Acts.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Acts like Companies Act lack tax provision yet companies taxable.

holdings.text: Income derived by appellant from transport activities is not income of State under Art.289(1); taxable under Income-tax Act.
Appellant not local authority; no repugnancy between Income-tax Act and Road Transport Corporations Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Akadasi Padhan v. State of Orissa
precedents_cited.relevance: Scope of 'carrying on by the State' under Art.19(6); analogy to agents but distinguished for Art.289.

precedents_cited.case_name: Graves v. People of the State of New York ex rel. O'Keefe
precedents_cited.relevance: Federal corporation activities governmental, immune; rejected as not construing Art.289.
Federal corporation for war solely agent's; rejected for Art.289.

precedents_cited.case_name: State of West Bengal v. Union of India
precedents_cited.relevance: Rejected American doctrine of instrumentalities immunity.

precedents_cited.case_name: In re Sea Customs Act, Special Reference No.1 of 1962
precedents_cited.relevance: Art.289(1) immunity not extend to customs/excise duties.
Corporation separate from Crown/State, no immunities.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Exemption of State property/income from Union tax; cl.(1) general exemption if State's; cl.(2) exception for trade/business by/on behalf of State; cl.(3) declaration for incidental functions.

statutes_cited.name: Road Transport Corporations Act, 1950
statutes_cited.relevance: Establishes corporation as separate body corporate; capital, funds, profits disposal; emphasizes separate entity; s.30 remainder to State for road development.

statutes_cited.name: Income-tax Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Categories of assessees; notice for assessment; charging section.

statutes_cited.name: State Financial Corporations Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Corporation liable to income-tax as company; absence in RTC Act does not imply exemption.

statutes_cited.name: Damodar Valley Corporation Act, 1948
statutes_cited.relevance: Similar to State Financial Corporations Act.

outcome.summary: Appeals dismissed with costs; High Court order upheld; appellant's income from road transport activities held taxable as not income of the State under Art.289(1); corporation has separate legal entity.

key_quotes.text: "The property and income of a State shall be exempt from Union taxation."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Quotes Art.289(1); crux of exemption claim.

key_quotes.text: Income derived by the appellant from its trading activity cannot be said to be the income of the State under Art. 289(1).
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: The Corporation, though statutory, has a personality of its own and this personality is distinct from that of the State.
key_quotes.speaker: court
